channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping next to Valegro House, 6th August
item.description:
A lot of rubbish not cleaned for weeks on the Norman Road side next to Valegro House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 114, Norman Road, London

item.title: Uneven pavement with broken and loose bits of slab, 6th August
item.description:
Previously reported outside 43 Westfield, but it's 47. The alleged "fix" to tarmac fill part of a slab has left the other part alone, which has now broken and is loose.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westfield Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Food in dumped and broken with waste spilling out, 6th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malcolm Road, Penge, London

item.title: Fly tip Construction waste., 6th August
item.description:
I have reported this fly tip a few times as someone has dumped construction waste on institute place by the bins. There was a skip there but was not their waste and skip now gone. It’s on public land and no one is taking responsibility.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Institute Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Items dumped along right hand side of Goodmead Road., 6th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goodmead Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Rats, 6th August
item.description:
There are now several rats and mice in this location, running freely around the bins to the rear of Starbucks. The rats can be seen running in and out of broken paving - please can this be fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Venner Road, Perry Vale, London

item.title: Along the sidewalk of Cambridge Avenue, 6th August
item.description:
Leaves constantly accumulate in front of our entrance because they blow over from the street and nearby public trees. There are no trees on our side, so it’s not from our property. Street cleaning crews regularly clear the pavement and road nearby but skip these small areas, even though the leaves and rubbish clearly come from the same source. Cleaning one section but leaving this spot defeats the purpose, so I’m requesting that it be included in regular cleaning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet
